aoop.asteroids.model

Class Spaceship

  • java.lang.Object
    • aoop.asteroids.model.GameObject
      • aoop.asteroids.model.Spaceship

  • public class Spaceship
extends GameObject
    This class represents the player in the Asteroids game. A spaceship is able to shoot every 20 game ticks (twice per second).

    A massive difference with other game objects is that the spaceship has a certain direction in which it is pointed. This influences the way it is drawn and determines the direction of spawned bullets. Although the game setting is in outer space, the spaceship is subject to traction and will slowly deaccelerate.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Spaceship

        public Spaceship()
        Constructs a new spaceship with default values.

      • Spaceship

        private Spaceship(java.awt.Point location,
                  double velocityX,
                  double velocityY,
                  int radius,
                  double direction,
                  boolean up,
                  int score)
        Constructs a new spaceship using all specified information. Fields that do not have a parameter are initialized to default values. This constructor is primarily used for cloning a spaceship. All parameters are important to access from a cloned instance.
        Parameters:
        location - location of the spaceship.
        velocityX - velocity in X direction.
        velocityY - velocity in Y direction.
        radius - radius.
        direction - direction.
        up - indicator for accelarating button.
        score - score.

      • nextStep

        public void nextStep()
        Defines the behaviour of the spaceship. In each game tick the ship turns when a turn button is pressed. The speed at which it turns is 2% of a full rotation per game tick. Afterwards the spaceships velocity will be updated if the player wants to accelerate. The velocity however is resticted to 10 pixels per game tick in both X and Y direction. Afterwards the location of the ship will be updated and the velocity decreased to account for traction.
        Specified by:
        nextStep in class GameObject

      • clone

        public Spaceship clone()
        Returns a copy of the spaceship. Note that only interesting fields are copied into the clone.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        an exact copy of the spaceship.

        public boolean isAccelerating()
        Returns whether the spaceship is accelerating.
        Returns:
        true if up button is pressed, false otherwise.

      • isFiring

        public boolean isFiring()
        Returns whether the spaceship is firing.
        Returns:
        true if the spacehip is firing, false otherwise.

      • setFired

        public void setFired()
        Sets the fire tick counter to 20. For the next 20 game ticks this spaceship is not allowed to fire.
